extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • parseWithNew

        public Pair<JavaElementArrangementEntry,java.util.List<JavaElementArrangementEntry>> parseWithNew(PsiElement root,
                                                                                                  Document document,
                                                                                                  java.util.Collection<TextRange> ranges,
                                                                                                  PsiElement element,
                                                                                                  ArrangementSettings settings)
        Description copied from interface: Rearranger
        Tries to wrap given element into arrangement entry at the target context.

        This is useful in a situation when new element is generated and we're deciding where to insert it (e.g. new field is generated and we want to insert it according to the arrangement rules like 'fields before methods').

        Specified by:
        parseWithNew in interface Rearranger<JavaElementArrangementEntry>
        element - element to wrap into format eligible for further processing by arrangement engine
        settings - arrangement settings to use. The primary idea is to make the rearranger aware about grouping rules (if any). E.g. it's not worth to process java method bodies in order to build method dependency graph if no such grouping rule is defined
        Returns:
        arrangement entry for the given element if it's possible to perform the mapping and list of arrangement entries available at the given context plus newly created entry for the given element; null otherwise

      • parse

        public java.util.List<JavaElementArrangementEntry> parse(PsiElement root,
                                                         Document document,
                                                         java.util.Collection<TextRange> ranges,
                                                         ArrangementSettings settings)
        Description copied from interface: Rearranger
        Allows to build rearranger-interested data for the given element.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface Rearranger<JavaElementArrangementEntry>
        Parameters:
        root - root element which children should be parsed for the rearrangement
        document - document which corresponds to the target PSI tree
        ranges - target offsets ranges to use for filtering given root's children
        settings - arrangement settings to use. The primary idea is to make the rearranger aware about grouping rules (if any). E.g. it's not worth to process java method bodies in order to build method dependency graph if no such grouping rule is defined
        Returns:
        given root's children which are subject for further rearrangement

      • getBlankLines

        public int getBlankLines(CodeStyleSettings settings,
                         JavaElementArrangementEntry parent,
                         JavaElementArrangementEntry previous,
                         JavaElementArrangementEntry target)
        Description copied from interface: Rearranger
        Allows to answer how many blank lines should be inserted before the target arrangement entry which position is changed.
        Specified by:
        getBlankLines in interface Rearranger<JavaElementArrangementEntry>
        Parameters:
        settings - code style settings to use (it's assumed that returned result is derived from 'blank lines' code style settings)
        parent - target entry's parent (if available)
        previous - previous entry (if available)
        target - target entry which blank lines number the caller is interested in
        Returns:
        number of blank lines to insert before the target entry; negative as an indication that no blank lines adjustment is necessary

      • getSerializer

        public ArrangementSettingsSerializer getSerializer()
        Specified by:
        getSerializer in interface Rearranger<JavaElementArrangementEntry>
        Returns:
        serializer to save arrangement settings. Serializer is expected to be lazy and don't save default settings.

        See Also:
        DefaultArrangementSettingsSerializer

      • getDefaultSettings

        public StdArrangementSettings getDefaultSettings()
        Specified by:
        getDefaultSettings in interface ArrangementStandardSettingsAware
        Returns:
        settings to use by default, i.e. when a user hasn't been explicitly modified arrangement settings; null as an indication that no default settings are available

      • getSupportedGroupingTokens

        Specified by:
        getSupportedGroupingTokens in interface ArrangementStandardSettingsAware
        Returns:
        ordered collection of grouping tokens eligible to use with the current rearranger. Note: platform code which uses this method caches returned results

      • getSupportedMatchingTokens

        public java.util.List<CompositeArrangementSettingsToken> getSupportedMatchingTokens()
        Specified by:
        getSupportedMatchingTokens in interface ArrangementStandardSettingsAware
        Returns:
        ordered collection of matching tokens eligible to use with the current rearranger Note: platform code which uses this method caches returned results

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(ArrangementSettingsToken token,
                         ArrangementMatchCondition current)
        Description copied from interface: ArrangementStandardSettingsAware
        Allows to answer if given token is enabled in combination with other conditions specified by the given condition object.

        Example: say, current rearranger is for java and given condition is like 'public class'. This method is expected to return false for token 'volatile' (because it can be applied only to fields) but true for token 'abstract' (a java class can be abstract).

        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface ArrangementStandardSettingsAware
        Parameters:
        token - target token to check
        current - an object which represents currently chosen tokens; null if no other token is selected
        Returns:
        true if given token is enabled with the given condition; false otherwise

      • buildMatcher

        public ArrangementEntryMatcher buildMatcher(ArrangementMatchCondition condition)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: ArrangementStandardSettingsAware
        This method is assumed to be used only by third-party developers. All built-in IJ conditions are supposed to be implemented in terms of StdArrangementTokens.
        Specified by:
        buildMatcher in interface ArrangementStandardSettingsAware
        Parameters:
        condition - target condition
        Returns:
        a matcher for the given condition
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if current rearranger doesn't know how to build a matcher from the given condition

      • getMutexes

        public java.util.Collection<java.util.Set<ArrangementSettingsToken>> getMutexes()
        Specified by:
        getMutexes in interface ArrangementStandardSettingsAware
        Returns:
        collections of mutual exclusion settings. It's is used by standard arrangement settings UI to automatically deselect elements on selection change. Example: 'private' modifier was selected. When any other modifier is selected 'public' modifier is deselected if returned collection contains set of all supported visibility modifiers
